Description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, TV channels and production studios. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.

We may have started in the Nordics, but we have a global mindset and consider ourselves to be the international entertainment provider. This means we’re constantly launching our Viaplay streaming service in new markets and on the lookout for talented, curious, driven professionals to join us on our journey.

Right now, we’re searching for a Machine Learning Engineer to the Applied Machine Learning team in our Stockholm office.

The role

As a ML Engineer you will bring to life recommender systems and other intelligent services that personalize and enhance the experience on our video on demand (VOD) streaming service Viaplay. 

You will work in an empathic and supportive team with other Data Scientists and Machine Learning... Engineers who share knowledge and experience in researching and developing data products. You love seeing things go into production and love the idea of seeing on-point recommendations produced by algorithms. You enjoy prototyping new data applications and work with teammates to bring projects onto all parts of our streaming service. You believe that maintaining models is a must in the data product development lifecycle.

You will be able to use and develop your machine learning and engineering competence on massive amounts of data from Viaplay’s Data Lake, containing everything from customer and viewing behavior to every detail about our movie, television, and sports content. As a ML Engineer you will play a key role to move data products to production, making it easier for customers to find the content they love and make the streaming service more intelligent. You will also help maintain ML systems so that the personalized experience continues to be personalized.

Our technology stack offers great opportunities to showcase and develop your data science skills. You will work on AWS for computation and storage, using Python and Spark to breathe life to cloud-based data products.

What we’re looking for

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
• Strong communicator and listener.
• Affinity towards teaming up with other curious minds to tackle mathematical and engineering challenges.
• Academic degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or equivalent.
• Have 2+ years working experience creating production-grade machine learning solutions for product problems.
• Solid understanding of various machine learning techniques, both theoretical and practical.
• High Competence in Python and SQL, transforming data with Spark is a plus.
• Knowledge of containerizing ML models in a cloud environment such as AWS.

Our offering
• We’ve got the basics covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, flexible work arrangements and extra compensation on top of a parental pay lift.
• Your wellbeing matters. We have an attractive pension and insurance scheme with full health care coverage should you need it.
• A safe space to grow and up-skill with the freedom to try new things in autonomous teams. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development, while always making sure you feel supported with regular knowledge-sharing sessions, technical training, mentorship opportunities and peer-to-peer networks.
• An innovative environment with Hack Days, not once, but twice a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
• A genuinely international and diverse group of colleagues to connect with. We’re striving towards a 50:50 gender balance & we’re not far off – plus last time we checked, we have more than 60 different nationalities across our nine offices!
• Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including live sports & pay per view events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.

Hit play today

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away

Job-Title: Machine Learning Research Engineer - 3D Vision (available in Stockholm or...
Description:
Summary
Posted: Oct 7, 2022

Role Number:200308407

The 3D Vision team at Apple Maps is looking for extraordinary talent to join our team of computer vision and machine learning experts. With us, you will be working on cutting-edge technology as well as researching and developing new machine learning algorithms for processing and making sense of vast volumes of sensor data!

As part of this team you would be working on extremely large data sets of different modalities, collected by various moving platforms - aerial/satellite/ground. You need to have a strong interest in solving real world problems where developing and implementing algorithms are important parts. You would join a team of fast paced and pragmatic problem solvers that are solving some of the toughest problems in the industry!

Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
• Proven fundamentals in Modern Machine Learning.
• Solid experience with deep learning frameworks and infrastructure.
• Experience with C/C++ is a plus.
•... Experience with 3D Computer Vision is a plus.
• Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner.

Description

Description
The ideal candidate should be an excellent programmer and also excel in one or more of the following areas: General Deep Learning, Visual Object Detection and Recognition, Semantic Segmentation, Optical character recognition in unconstrained environments. Meriting experience include: 3D computer vision, computational geometry, computer graphics, image processing, applied mathematics.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience
PhD or Master of Science degree in Computer Science or similar, alternatively a comparable industry career with a consistent track record of successful projects.

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements

Be visionary

At Teledyne FLIR, we have a simple but ambitious mission: to develop market-leading thermal and sensing technologies which enhance everyday life. From saving energy, to saving lives Teledyne FLIR is making a real difference in our world.

Our products are used in a wide array of situations to rescue people in danger, detect criminals, conserve energy, navigate safely, provide security around the globe, and protect our environment.

We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.

Job Description

Be Visionary

At FLIR, we have a simple but ambitious mission: to develop market-leading thermal and sensing technologies that enhance everyday life. From saving energy to saving lives, FLIR is making a real difference in our world.

Our products are used in a wide array of situations to rescue people in danger, detect criminals, conserve energy, navigate safely, provide security around the globe, and protect... our environment.

We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.

Job Description

For our I ntelligent T ransportation S ystems (ITS) R&D team in Kortrijk (Belgium) (or Täby – Sweden) we are looking for a creative, passionate and hands-on Senior Machine Learning Engineer with a solid background in AI for object detection & classification solution on the edge. You will be part of a team that is responsible to design and learn convolutional neural networks for visual and infrared sensors for different businesses.

Responsibility
• Create more efficient object detection and classification models for different businesses
• In collaboration with other colleagues, develop and implement advanced algorithms on embedded camera’s
• Responsible to evaluate the performance of implemented algorithms
• Following the state of the art in the field of computer vision
• Documenting and share the knowledge along the international AI team

Candidate Profile
• You are passionate about Computer Vision, Image Processing , Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.
• You have a degree (master or PhD) in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or other related field and/or specific training
• Experience with programming in C++ / python is a plus
• Experience with object-oriented design methodology and concepts is a plus
• Must be a results-oriented professional with solid organizational and time management skills

What FLIR offers you
• To be a part of a market leader company with a 50 years track record
• At FLIR, you get a unique opportunity to experience how cutting edge R&D, software- and hardware development come together under one roof. We do our own research, our own development, and our own manufacturing
• Permanent employment
• Friendly culture with a focus on collaboration, problem-solving and creativity
• Fair compensation structure and benefits

Interested?

If you liked what you just read, and believe you are the person that will make us better, do not hesitate to apply.

The selection process is ongoing, so don't wait. When applying, make it easy for yourself. Add a resume and fill out the required fields, no need to add anything else at this point. We accept applications in English.

Teledyne FLIR and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.

Teledyne FLIR is an equal opportunity employer.

You may not realize it, but Teledyne enables many of the products and services you use every day .

Teledyne provides enabling technologies to sense, transmit and analyze information for industrial growth markets, including aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, energy, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research

Job-Title: R&D Data Sciences & AI Graduate Programme - Sweden
Description:
R&D Data Sciences & AI Graduate Programme – Sweden

Locations: Gothenburg (Sweden)

Fuel your curiosity, feel valued and follow the science

If you have a quantitative science focused bachelor’s or master’s degree and a desire to explore and develop your skills in data science and artificial intelligence within a global biopharmaceutical organisation, our R&D Data Science & AI Graduate Programme could be the perfect start to your career. You’ll gain invaluable insight, exposure and opportunities across our diverse, Research and Development organisation. We’ll accelerate your learning and help you achieve your potential.

About AstraZeneca

AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious diseases.

Embrace the novel opportunity to work at a business that puts patients first. Working with data and an agile mindset in our... constantly changing business, we help uncover solutions that power the business to better harness the science and get it to market. It means we play our part in reaching patients in need and influencing outcomes.

What does the programme involve?

Starting in September 2023, the programme lasts two years, consisting of three individual eight month placements. Each placement will provide you with fantastic insights and experience in our use of machine learning, AI and data science to advance drug discovery and development.

The programme’s variety and flexibility provides you with opportunities to apply machine learning, AI, and data science techniques to help push our scientists push the boundaries of science to develop life changing medicines for patients worldwide. You could be contributing to detecting safety risks, designing novel molecules, optimising clinical trial design and processes, or developing new models for use in high profile drug discovery and development projects. As well as helping you broaden your industry and technical knowledge, we’ll help you develop professional skills required to fulfill your career potential.

You will gain an invaluable blend of on-the-job experience and training. You’ll enjoy guidance and advice from a huge support network, including a mentor and dedicated programme management team. We’ll also encourage you to identify and build collaborative relationships with specialists and leaders across our organisation, and our external networks including leading academic and biotech research institutions.

Together, we’ll help accelerate your development and knowledge!

Essential requirements
• Highly numerate with a strong quantitative science (e.g. Maths, Physics, Statistics or Computer Science) focused Bachelors or Masters level qualification gained in 2022 or due to be completed by September 2023
• Hands-on experience in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computational Biology, Computational Chemistry, Bioinformatics or Cheminformatics
• Deep understanding of a few key machine learning or statistical models
• Considerable experience in Python or experience with multiple data-centric programming languages enabling Big data analysis
• Innovative thinking, with enthusiasm, energy and drive
• Open-minded, and ready to embrace new ideas and different perspectives
• Strong critical thinking, planning, organisational and time management skills
• Ability to work as part of a collaborative team
• Able to start employment in September 2023

Together, we push the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients around the world!

Where can I find out more?

Early careers at AstraZeneca

Our Social Media

Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/

Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/

Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

What next?

After you submit your application, you will be asked to complete an online assessment (SHL). If shortlisted, you will then be invited to a full day virtual assessment day.

Our virtual assessment days will be held week commencing 17th April 2023

Advert Opens 06 December 2022

Advert closes 19 February 2023

AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements

Are you looking for an exciting intern project in machine learning? Do you want to try out the experiments we’ve always been wanting to do but never have time for?

We are Sinch. With presence in more than 50 countries, we’re a growing global organization that helps amazing companies engage with customers on their mobile phones. And whether you know us or not, you’ve definitely used our tech. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year.

It’s not easy to reach every person, on every phone, on every channel, everywhere. Create the software that makes it happen. Join our team as a Machine Learning Intern in our AI&ML engineering team.

The essence of the role

We are growing rapidly and are constantly looking for skilled engineers. Doing an internship project at Sinch can be a first step towards becoming a fulltime "Sincher" or it can be a steppingstone for your career.

We have a number of different ideas on projects! Let us know which one(s) you are... interested in. We are happy to discuss our ideas further and are always open to iterate and improve them.

To support you in your project you will have a supervisor from Sinch side who is chosen depending on the area of the project.

Sounds interesting? Join our Kaggle competition to build an intent classifier in order to apply.

In order to compete:
• Apply for the role and answer the questions in the application form
• Go to the Kaggle competition, sign up and send in a submission with a great performance

Some of our project ideas are:
• Make Question Answering model less sensitive to grammatical errors and phrasing differences
• Develop conversational capabilities to Language Agnostic Question Answering model
• Investigate real-time text-to-speech possibilities
• Data augmentation for multilabel text classification
• Create light ML models using sparsification
• Image search based on the image content using textual search queries

Who are you?
• We are looking for final year Master students in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial intelligence or people with equivalent practical experience.
• The project needs to be around 4-6 months, but the minimum is 3 months.
• Do you have a fellow student in mind as a project partner? That’s great, It’s not a requirement but it’s a bonus if you have each other (please send one application and don’t forget to answer the questions in the application form)
• Location: Preferably Sweden, since most of us is in the CET time zone and many fellow colleagues are based in Sweden. But if you at least have 3 hours overlapping with the CET time zone you can also work remotely.

We believe you are an ambitious student with a great interest and curiosity in the AI and ML field. We expect you to plan and drive your work yourselves but will offer you the support you need from people within Sinch.

Are you ready? Be partof our journey and join our machine learning competition!

As a first step, and for you to get an idea of what you are in for, we have created a Kaggle competition to build an intent classifier.

In order to compete:
• Apply for the role and answer the questions in the application form
• Go to the Kaggle competition, sign up and send in your best ML model.

About the recruitment process:

To help us place the right people in the right role, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. We follow a competence-based, structured interview process where your skills, experience and attributes relevant to the role and Sinch will be assessed. As part of our recruitment process, pre-employment testing is used to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role. We acknowledge that there are two parties making a decision in this process and welcome you to ask any questions you may have at any stage of the process

Who is ArK?
There are many consumer facing fintech products, but finance as a whole is virtually untouched by technology. Investment decisions are still being made out of pdf’s and “shark tank”-like processes rather than utilising the forecasting methods found at companies like Spotify or Google. This makes capital allocation riddled with bias and very ripe for disruption.

At ArK we’re convinced that by putting data and tech at the heart of finance we can impact how money flows and, in turn, create a more democratised and unbiased economy.

Today we offer founders access to our machine learning platform AIM. Through connecting their raw data we can fully understand what they’ve built without any bias; connecting what has been achieved historically into a simulated 5-year future. This prediction is the foundation for the transformational loans that we are able to issue, and a tool that founders get to keep for business optimisation.

AiM is using big data and machine learning to... analyse and predict companies’ current and future performance, to be used as a foundation for our frontier credit decision making. All in all, we thrive in the win-win data modelling where insights are valuable both for ArK as a lender, but also for our customer as a growth company. We build AiM to push beyond “credit scoring”, and to become the unrivalled place to plug in your company data, and get back valuable insights for optimising company growth — when our customers grow efficiently, everybody wins.

Being an ML leader at ArK

ArK has one of the most diverse sets of company data in the world, and it is growing at an incredible pace. The diversity and richness of data we want you to work with is essentially unheard of as we get raw data directly from our customers’ IT systems, and we want your help to make sense of it, both for us, and for our customers. The challenges here are unlike anywhere else as we’re striving to build generalizable modelling solutions that can be applied across an incredibly broad range of company data and business models.

Some of the problems that we help our customers solve are figuring out really detailed customer lifetime values (e.g. placing a value on our customers’ customers) and projecting their future revenue and cost growth — which conveniently enough is excellent data to base lending decisions on and tailor financing solutions to.

We’re also exploring advanced user churn modelling, credit scoring, customer business clustering and performance benchmarking and various clustering techniques to better understand businesses and their customers. As a leader at ArK we want you to help us define what’s possible and work on what’s valuable.

At ArK you will be a part of our tech and analytics teams and work with data engineers, data scientists, UX designers, data analysts and other ML professionals — bringing your unique skills to the table.

You are …
• … Someone who wants to lead and run Machine Learning projects from data crunching and prototyping — to quality assured models that run in a production environment.
• … Knowledgeable in the inner workings of the models you apply, and how to construct and optimise for suitable loss functions — and other similar concepts
• … Driven by impact and can deliver business value from projects fast, and then iterate over time to increase that value further
• … Interested both in the modelling and the engineering aspects of building good ML that works reliably
• … A future or current leader in the space who stays up to date and are not afraid to deploy modern techniques, and mentor and knowledge share with colleagues

Nice-to-have
• Experience from a product centric company
• Product and/or people leadership/management experience
• Experience writing blogs or articles, we really want to give back to the community and share our work and findings

More about who we are at ArK

ArK was founded in 2021 by a six-time entrepreneur, a world-class AI technology developer and a veteran banker. Since then we’ve carefully grown our team to 30 - all pitching in with their experience to build something that none of us has seen before.

We believe that the key to a great team culture is great people having a great time together. Our team is one to be part of for the long run, because you won’t want to leave. Our unique combination of startup mentality, experienced team and ambitious vision make ample room for possibilities to grow.

ArK is headquartered in Stockholm but we balance our time between being at the office and working remotely

About Us

At Pagos, we’re passionate about empowering businesses to take control of their payments stack and solve the puzzles standing between them and optimized growth. Our global platform provides developers, product teams, and payments leaders with both a deeper understanding of their payments data and access to new payments technology through user-friendly tools that are easy to implement. To succeed in this, we need creative thinkers who are willing to roll up their sleeves and start building alongside us.

About the Role

In this role, you’ll play a key part in building out the core foundation of machine learning at Pagos. We're looking for someone dedicated to continuously learning and staying aligned with developments in machine learning engineering and best practices. You'll have the opportunity to apply emerging innovations and solutions to provide best-in-class solutions to our clients.

As the Lead Machine Learning Engineer, you will:
• Design, build, and deploy models... that solve complex business problems
• Partner with engineers and product leaders across Pagos to build products that delight our customers
• Create ML models for real time solutions that allow companies to incorporate data-driven decisions into the payment stack to save money and grow revenue - including anomaly detection, recommendation, and prediction use cases

What We’re Looking For

We’re looking for someone with:
• 7+ years of professional experience as a Machine Learning Engineer and/or Data Scientist
• Strong experience with data analysis, feature exploration, ETL, and visualization
• Highly proficient with SQL, and has the ability to independently source data for projects and analysis
• Strong programming skills in Python, including exposure to the python ML ecosystem (Numpy, pandas, statsmodels, sklearn, TensorFlow/PyTorch, etc.)
• Experience with model versioning and lifecycle management (mlflow), version control (Git), job orchestration (e.g. Airflow), and artifact management such as PyPi (nice to have)
• Experience in deploying machine-learning models as scalable services
• Familiarity with parallel processing databases (Snowflake or Redshift, etc) and large-scale data processing and distributed systems (Spark or Dask, etc.)
• Proven experience shipping high quality, well-documented code

Nice to haves:
• Experience with data visualization tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc.
• Prior leadership experience, ownership of projects/products, and working collaboratively to carry those projects/products to production
• Prior experience with fintech, trading, transaction or payments data for optimization, fraud, recommendation, routing or tracking

Global companies and governmental entities rely on us to solve their most complex data challenges. Our employees collaborate to reduce risks and create opportunities for customers in more than 100 countries. We're adaptable, curious and ambitious. That's why here, you'll have the freedom to drive change, the trust to find your own path, and the space to explore more. Machine Learning Engineer/Data Scientist From our research and engineering teams in Sweden and Germany to our sales, business and marketing offices around the world, BehavioSec is committed to making a better, more secure internet. Our company is always looking for enthusiastic, committed and smart people. As a member of our team, you'll be contributing to a total rethink of how companies secure experiences for customers and users around the world to reduce fraud.
THE PROBLEMS

BehavioSec power real-time analyzing of behavioral data for Fraud prevention and authentication. We analyze data collected from the user and... validates it against a stored profile for that user and calculates a risk of fraudulent usage for the session.
RESPONSIBILITIES
• The position is mixed between data research and implementing sample code
• Work with a team with different backgrounds to frame problems, both mathematically and business wise.
• Perform exploratory data analysis to gain a deeper understanding of the problem.
• Construct and fit statistical, machine learning, or optimization models
• Write production modeling code; collaborate with Software Engineers to implement algorithms in production
• Analyze and Visualize findings and data to further enhance the product.

EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
• M.S. or Ph.D. in Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering Physics or another quantitative field.
• Passion for solving unstructured and non-standard mathematical problems.
• End-to-end experience with data, including querying, aggregation, analysis, and visualization.
• Proficiency with Python Java or other programming languages.
• Willingness to collaborate and communicate with others to solve a problem.

BEING A PART OF THE BEHAVIOSEC TEAM
• Have Impact: We take on meaningful and challenging projects that affect fraud prevention on a global scale.
• Collaborate: We work internally with people from a variety of backgrounds - such as product teams, engineering teams, sales teams. We also work externally with our customers, often on site, to understand and solve their problems.
• Have Independence: We trust each other to effectively manage time and priorities-we don't micromanage. We want to give people the space to think for themselves.
• Grow: We push ourselves and our peers to improve themselves and the world around them.

#LI-MH1 #LI-Hybrid

We are looking for a Senior ML Engineer to join our team in Indivd.

Responsibilities:

You will work in an experienced team in delivering better deep learning models for computer vision, optimise the cloud GPU deployment and designing meaningful insights together with the end-users. We expect you to have several years of experience with several computer vision projects in your portfolio.

Requirements:
• C++
• Excellent knowledge of PyTorch/TensorFlow
• Rich experience in Computer Vision
• Deep Learning
• Machine Learning
• Statistics
• Python
• Upper-intermediate English

Will be a plus:
• TensorRT
• DeepStream
• Facial Recognition
• Object Detection/tracking

Conditions:

We can offer excellent salary, company laptop, freedom to work in an office or remotely and follow an exciting development together with some of the world's leading experts, entrepreneurs and investors. Generous options programmes are available for key employees.

Job-Title: Sr. Specialist AI ML & Data Analytics
Description:
About this opportunity

In the communication services area, the demands from customers on real-time data from their networks is spectacularly increasing. Among other things, data can be used for measuring network performance, simplifying and automating network operations and dimension the networks for optimal resource utilization. These new demands require a fundamental re-design of data management in the IMS solution. Data can also be used to optimize and improve internal efficiency within the R&D operations.

This Senior Specialist position domain focuses on Data Analytics as a whole, as well as associated technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML).

Data Analytics, with the use of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, encapsulate opportunities not only in our products and services but also related to internal efficiency in our development flows (CI/CD) as well as in delivery flows (SWDP). To increasingly use these technologies are well in... line with the BDGS strategies for the coming years and well in line with customer expectations related to our cloud-native IMS product portfolio.

It is important for PDU Voice and UDM to have a Senior Specialist position and competence in Data Analytics, AI/ML, to ensure that the opportunities that are presented now as part of the important technology shift towards cloud-native, include the aspects needed at an early stage to be able to demonstrate on the Data Analytics, AI and ML technologies, being part of the BCSS and SA Core Networks/Core Networks Engineering strategic direction.

What you will do
• Applying relevant innovative methodologies and tools across the AI/ML spectrum to enhance the IMS solutions and SA Core Networks portfolio value.
• Evaluating AI/ML software libraries, frameworks, and algorithms against quantitative criteria such as performance, efficiency, accuracy, and size, as well as qualitative aspects such as complexity, ease-of-use, and general business needs.
• Working in close collaboration with data scientists, data engineers, Solution Line, Customer Units and IMS Development Programs, acting also as an interface between Core Networks Engineering and GAIA (Global AI Accelerator), with the aim to better understand IMS application problems and customer requirements and help integrate Data Analytics, AI/ML techniques where needed.
• Driving the implementation architecture of our Cloud Native IMS product to enable Data Analytics, AI/ML in order to implement upon relevant technology and portfolio strategies within BCSS and Core Networks Engineering.
• Driving and contributing to IPRs in the AI/ML domain, particularly for use cases relevant to the IMS product and BCSS portfolio.
• Prototyping methods for data preparation, pre-processing (data cleaning and feature extraction) and data ingestion.
• Prototyping and evaluating ML model training and validation principles.
• Publishing papers externally and attending and participating across external conferences and summits in the area of Data Analytics, AI/ML.
• Driving and engaging in Data Analytics study groups, reference groups and technology leadership programs within Ericsson.
• Contributing to the development of Data Analytics AI/ML competence by driving and participating in knowledge-sharing activities across the BA and Ericsson.

You will To be successful in your role, we expect you to:
• Have a Master of Science degree in Data Science or equivalent.
• Have experience in and understanding of use cases within the telecommunications domain related signaling, software life cycle management, analytics and assurance, verification and delivery pipelines. Experience from the IMS domain specifically is of great value.
• Be a transformative leader with ability to depict and describe strategic directions and wanted positions, both long term as well as short term intermediate steps.
• Possess a good ability to translate technical scenarios into business value for customers or internal value in terms of improved efficiency.
• Have strong, general leadership and communication skills.

Why join Ericsson?

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

What happens once you apply?

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.

Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

Primary country and city: Sweden (SE) || Sweden : Stockholm : Stockholm

Req ID: 697895
